SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: Data Driven Education & Ed-FiThese direct charitable activities support the delivery of modern, flexible, powerful and actionable student-centric education data systems for K-12 schools that educators use to better serve their students. They also support the development of the Ed-Fi solution - a free, flexible and complete ed-tech solution to empower educators with relevant, timely information that enables better data collection to drive improved student outcomes. They also support the creation and implementation of an education data system in South Africa that is designed to improve student outcomes through district management tools and best practice sharing.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: Global Scholarship/University SuccessThese direct charitable activities support student resources and equipment, such as computers and textbooks, as well as the implementation of and improvements to global scholarship tools in the US and South Africa. They also support a robust US scholarship program application platform. Additionally, these activities provide persistence and completion support services to eligible UT Austin Pell students.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: Educational Initiatives K-12These direct charitable activities support pre-university education quality improvement projects in the US, India and South Africa. Additionally, they support assessments of education improvement efforts.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: Jobs & LivelihoodsThese direct charitable activities support the development of market-based models in the US, India and South Africa to provide families from under-resourced communities access to financial tools, skill development and employment opportunities in order to establish financial stability. Additionally, these direct charitable activities support a goal of increasing capacity in the Central Texas medical community.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: Valenture Institute Holdings Ltd - Equity investment in a South African EdTech company that builds affordable online schooling for classroom or remote learning.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: Unitus Capital - Loan support to an Indian entity that is a wholesale lender to early & growth stage social enterprises.

RlnOfActyToAccomOfExmptPrpsGrp.RelationshipStatementTxt: Event & sponsorship fees: The Ed-Fi Alliance conducts an annual summit and bootcamp that brings together state and local education agency leaders, ed-tech vendors, technical experts and decision makers to connect, share, and learn about the advantages of data interoperability using the Ed-Fi data standard and technology tools. To help offset the costs of these events, Ed-Fi Alliance collects registration fees from attendees and sponsorship payments from organizations.

Subscription/implementation fees: College Success Tools ("CST") licenses its comprehensive, cloud-based student management Software as a Service ("SaaS") platform, GradSnapp, which empowers organizations to understand each student's journey through college and provides the support and interventions they need while saving time and budget. GradSnapp provides comprehensive student profiles, including student progress dashboards, risk indicators and more. To help offset the costs of these activities, CST collects subscription and implementation fees from licensing GradSnapp.

Interest/dividends - PRIs: The Foundation uses highly structured equity and loan investments to help select entrepreneurial organizations in education, vocational training, and financial inclusion that help socially driven entrepreneurs launch new products that open new markets to routinely provide families living in urban poverty with access to the best-in-class financial, educational, and other tools that can help them transform their lifetime prospects.

AllOtherProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Desc: Arthan Finance - Equity investment in an Indian NBFC that offers credit products such as secured and unsecured working capital loans and supply chain financing to micro and small enterprises.
Awign Enterprises Pvt. Ltd. - Equity investment in an Indian gig based micro jobs platform.
BetterLesson - Equity investment in a US for-profit education technology company which supports the continued growth of 1-to-1 virtual coaching for teachers to improve their instructional practice.

Bharat Inclusive Technologies Seed Holdings Limited - Equity investment in an India based "seed facility" fund that provides equity seed capital to early-stage companies to improve the financial and economic lives of low income families in India.
Enlabeler (Pty) Ltd - Equity investment in a South African early-stage company that provides remote earning opportunities for low-income South Africans as data labelers on their platform.

Josh Talks - Equity investment in an Indian company that operates a tech platform providing self-help channels on YouTube geared toward mentoring youth from low-income families in order to help them gain meaningful employment.
LabourNet - Loan support to an Indian staffing and skilling organization that creates livelihood opportunities for unemployed and underemployed youth.

Menterra Social Impact Fund I - Equity investment in an India based Alternate Investment Fund (AIF) (social venture fund) whose objective is to enhance learning levels for school going children and improving employability and income levels of youth from urban low income families in India.

Pravega Ventures Trust - Partnership investment in an Indian seed fund focused on investing in early stage organizations in the product trial or pre-revenue stages of its lifecycle and catering to Indian households with incomes less than INR 40,000 per month.

Pravega VC II Trust - Follow on partnership investment in an Indian seed fund focused on investing in early stage organizations in the product trial or pre-revenue stages of its lifecycle and catering to Indian households with incomes less than INR 40,000 per month.
Primrose Hill Ventures - Loan support to an Indian entity that offers loans to youth enrolling in identified courses with selected skill training partners, aimed at aiding in job placement.
Reach, LP - Equity investment in a U.S. based private equity fund set up to make negotiated investments (private) in companies focused on issues of access and opportunity in U.S. K-12 education.
Riviera Investors Private Limited - Loan guarantee support to a micro credit guarantee program in India.

Ruthless for Good Fund - Equity investment in a US fund that supports companies founded by black, indigenous and people of color. Their enterprises seek to improve access and well being for historically under-invested communities.
Shift South - Equity investment in a South African entity which supports domestic cleaners on a path towards economic stability.

Svakarma Finance Private Limited - Loan support to an Indian entity that offers nano and micro loans to underserved entrepreneurs to improve their incomes and generate employment for individuals from low income households.
UP Fund L.P - Equity investment in a US fund that helps to support over 4,000 low income students enrolling in and completing high quality training courses and being placed in high demand industries.

CompensationExplanationGrp.ShortExplanationTxt: Michael & Susan Dell Foundation (the Foundation) paid investment management fees of $1,500,000 to MSD Partners, L.P. during the tax year, pursuant to a services agreement, for ordinary and necessary personal services. Marc Lisker was employed by MSD Partners, L.P. as its Chief Legal Officer during the tax year. He is not employed or compensated by the Foundation. The investment management fees are not paid to Marc Lisker, are unrelated to his position as an officer/director of the foundation, and would be paid to MSD Partners, L.P. regardless of his services. The Foundation is making this disclosure pursuant to revised IRS guidance per Announcement 2021-18.

GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 7, Election to apply excess distributions from a prior year
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: Pursuant to Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(c)(2)(iv), the foundation hereby elects to treat, as a current distibution out of corpus, the following unused prior years distributions that were treated as corpus distributions under Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(d)(1)(iii) in such prior tax year:Tax Year Amount2017 $1,028,949 Michael and Susan Dell Foundation (MSDF) received contributions of $1,028,949 during its tax year ending 12/31/2021 from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, a private foundation, in support of MSDF's Ed-Fi Alliance Educator Preparation Data Model project. Pursuant to Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(c)(2)(iv), MSDF elects to treat, as a current distribution out of corpus, $1,028,949 of excess 2017 qualifying distributions that were treated as distributions out of corpus in such prior tax year to satisfy the requirements imposed by Section 4942(g)(3).
